definition: to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Drunken people often have slurred speech.
sentences.chinese: 喝醉酒的人说话时经常含糊不清。

sentences.english: Sometimes really ambiguous entries make it on the list because I trust my future self way too much.
sentences.chinese: 有时，我写下含糊不清的条目，这是自视甚高。

sentences.english: He writes his letter with extreme simplicity and uses vague and indefinite expressions.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: His speech blurred the more he drank.
sentences.chinese: 他喝酒越多，他的话越含糊不清。

sentences.english: His letter was very simple which expressed ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: His letter was too simple to be understood, with ambiguous expressions.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: His letter is very easy, and expression not clearly.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: Ambiguity and vagueness were no longer an option.
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可和含糊不清已不再为人所接受。

sentences.english: He slurred English. No man could understand him.
sentences.chinese: 他含糊不清地说着英语，没人能听得懂他说的是什么。

sentences.english: Don't be cagey or vague in headlines.
sentences.chinese: 不要在标题上小心谨慎和含糊不清。

sentences.english: You run into ambiguity only when you ignore context.
sentences.chinese: 只有忽略上下文的时候才会出现含糊不清。

sentences.english: All of that said, ambiguous data structures can be valuable.
sentences.chinese: 大家都说，含糊不清的数据也可能有价值。

sentences.english: Other potential indicators of deceit are descriptive vagueness or a quavering voice.
sentences.chinese: 含糊不清的描述和颤抖的声音也都是欺骗的信号。

sentences.english: His letter is very sample and expressed ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他的信写得极为简单，表达含糊不清。

sentences.english: The drunk man slurred his words.
Note that the term “meltdown” has a vague definition.
sentences.chinese: 需要注意的是，“熔毁”这个词定义含糊不清。

definition: to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
(idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
